intro: Utricularia amotape-huancabambensis, commonly known as the Huancabamba bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant native to the Amazonian regions of Peru. It is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit. The plant possesses specialized bladder-like structures used to trap and digest small aquatic organisms. It typically grows in shallow, slow-moving water bodies with rich organic substrates. Its unique morphology and carnivorous adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
